AVSEC Order No.3/2016

Subject : AVSEC Awareness Training to the employees of various stake holders
working at the civil airports in Indi:

In terms of Rule 3 (b) of the Aircraft (Security) Rules, 2011, it is directed that
Airport Entry Permit (AEP) shall not be issued to an employee working at the civil
airports in India unless he/ she has successfully undergone AVSEC Awareness training as
specified in the National Civil Aviation Security Training Programme. Therefore, each
employee of the concerned stake holders working at the civil airports in India shall be
imparted AVSEC Awareness Training once every year in accordance with the procedure
specified as under:

(1) AVSEC Awareness Training will be imparted to the employees of all the entities
working at the civil airports in India by BCAS certified AVSEC Instructors of the
Indian Aircraft operators free of charge once every year at the airports as
mentioned against each:

(2) The Regional Director, BCAS of the concerned Region shall ensure that the AVSEC
Awareness training is imparted to each employee working at the civil airports in the
region. The concerned Regional Director BCAS shall be responsible to coordinate with
the concerned aircraft operator well in time and yearly training schedule shall be
prepared well in advance by the concerned aircraft operator in consultation with
airport director under intimation to RD, BCAS.

(3) Database of AVSEC Awareness training will be maintained separately by the
concerned stake holder/ organisation of the employee, airport operator and the Aircraft
Operator allotted the airport in order to ensure that AVSEC awareness training is
imparted to all the employees every year. This database will be produced during the
security audits / inspections as and when carried out by BCAS officers.

(4) The Airport Director shall ensure to arrange for necessary infrastructure and
supporting resources for organising the training without any charge.

(5) An employee shall not be allowed to undergo AVSEC Awareness Training unless
his /her background check has been done and the same is valid at the time of training
being organised. It shall be ensured by the concerned stake holder that there should be
nothing adverse against an employee before being deputed for the said training.

(6) Any airline starting its operations from any airport which presently is non-
Operational for scheduled flights, will automatically take over the responsibility of that
airport for conduct of One Days AVSEC Awareness Training of all the staff of the
stakeholders at that airport.

(7) The AVSEC Awareness training will be conducted for One Complete day as per
syllabus provided at Annexure —"A”. In one batch no more than 50 trainees will be
entertained and the attendance sheet shall be signed invariably by the AVSEC Instructor
before the conduct of the training clearly mentioning his name, designation and
organisation.

(8) Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, Hyderabad and Cochin airports which are having their
‘own ASTIs will impart One Days AVSEC Awareness Training to all the employees at their

airports to their employees or their GHAs. GHAs can either ensure this training to their

certified Instructors on their pay roll.

(9) No BCAS certified Instructor will conduct AVSEC Awareness training in his individual
capacity in any of the airport in India, and will undertake such functions only when deputed
by his airline / organisation.

(10) One Days AVSEC Awareness Training is applicable only to Non-Security Staff
excluding Air Crew. All Security staff is required to undergo minimum Initial Induction
Course (5 days duration) and Air Crew, Basic AVSEC Course (6 days duration) for the purpose
of applying for an AEP. Those security staff and air crew who underwent these courses prior
to 2 years need to undergo refresher course before applying for an AEP.

(11) This order supersedes AVSEC Order 5/2004 dated 2" December 2004 and all other
directions issued on the conduct of One Days AVSEC Awareness Training and will be
enforced with immediate effect.
